Title: An exploration of the cognitive factors involved in learning from failure
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The impact of weather on imitation: A grounded cognition perspective
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study argues that ambient environment influences imitation and moderates how individuals use another's characteristics in deciding imitation by eliciting a particular kind of cognitive processing, either heuristic or analytical. Using weather as the ambient environment, and the earnings forecasts of financial analysts as the task, hypotheses were generally supported.
Index Keywords: Ambient environment; Cognitive processing; Earnings forecast; Financial analysts

Title: Principal-principal agency problem and shareholder activism: The rise of minority shareholder movement in Korea 2001-2008
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Drawing from the social movement perspective of corporate governance, we explore the dynamics of agency conflict between controlling and minority shareholders. We argue that business group owners tunnel resources from publicly traded firms to affiliated firms for their personal benefit. In response, we show how minority shareholder activism reduces tunneling.
Index Keywords: Business groups; Corporate governance; Principal agencies; Shareholder activisms; Social movements; Shareholders

Title: What happens when the honeymoon is over? the limited effect of impression management following controversial disruptions
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Effect of highly-innovative work practices and employee knowledge innovation on organizational innovation performance: A multilevel perspective
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: In recent years, many studies of organizational innovation have focused on how to improve organizational innovation performance, such as by examining external and internal factors affecting organizational innovation performance. This study analyzes the relationship between highly-innovative work practices, employee knowledge innovation behavior, and organizational innovation performance.
Index Keywords: Behavioral research; Knowledge management; Internal factors; Knowledge innovation; Organizational innovation; Work practices; Innovation

Title: Digital accommodation during corporate acquisitions
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: How entrepreneurs become strategic cultural operators
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The diffusion of contested practices across environments: Social movements' boundary-bridging role
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Moral cleansing as global self-worth maintenance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Privacy and freedom: An economic (re-)evaluation of privacy
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We re-evaluate privacy from the perspective of economic liberalism. Privacy is conceived as a specific form of freedom. Freedom cannot be 'self-defeating,' i.e. people are not free to give up their freedom. This idea extends to privacy and implies criteria to rule out restrictions on privacy.
Index Keywords: Privacy and freedoms

Title: Information seeking preferences of individuals in ethical decision making
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We empirically examined the changes in information-seeking preferences when organizational members recognize the ethical content of strategic decisions facing them. We found that decision-makers prefer to seek lower amounts of information, information from personal over impersonal sources, and information from sources internal to their organization to inform ethical decision-making.
Index Keywords: Decision making; Decision makers; Ethical decision making; Information seeking; Strategic decisions; Philosophical aspects

Title: Did you notice that? theorizing how people recognize (or not) the need for change
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A multilevel model of human capital contribution to company performance: Effects of hr practices and the emergence of human capital
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The engaged organization: Human capital, social capital, green capital and labor productivity
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The effects of socialized charismatic leadership on climate of respect, mistreatment, and work attitudes
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Using data collected from 239 employee-coworker dyads, we found that coworker perceptions of socialized charismatic leadership were negatively related to employee reports of workplace incivility and this relationship was mediated through employee perceptions regarding the extent to which respectful treatment among organizational members is valued and supported in the organization.
Index Keywords: Employee perceptions; Work attitudes

Title: The contextual specificity of human and organizational capital for innovation
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Despite the importance of innovation process effectiveness (IPE) for organizational innovativeness, little research has examined facilitators of IPE. We propose that IPE depends on human and organizational capital, with the relative impact of each differing between health care and other innovative industries due to differences in industry-specific knowledge properties.
Index Keywords: Innovation process; Organizational innovativeness; Relative impact; Specific knowledge

Title: Value proposition evolution and the performance of internal corporate ventures
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The clock is ticking! ceo temporal depth, industry clockspeed, and competitive action speed
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examine how the interplay between CEO temporal depth (time horizons that executives consider when contemplating past and future events) and industry clockspeed (rate of industry change) shapes competitive action speed. We found that executive temporal depth related differently with competitive action speed in slow and fast clockspeed industries.
Index Keywords: Industry change; Time horizons; Clocks

Title: Holding out for a hero? team social network structures affect attirbutions of charismatic leadership to men and women
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Confused by the middle: Status, acquisition advisors, and their opportunism in acquisition premium
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The emotional link: Exploring how ethical leaders shape follower ethical behavior
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: What strategic management has to do with capitalism(s)?
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Can stories shape strategy? narrative-structured information and strategic decision making
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: In treating information as homogeneous, prior research examining strategic decisions has left a fundamental question unanswered: Are some forms of information more influential than others? In this paper, we propose that narrative-structured information is more likely than nonnarratives to be granted attention, analyzed, recalled, and communicated in strategic decision making.
Index Keywords: Strategic decision making; Strategic decisions; Structured information; Decision making

Title: Fit to be unethical: How succesful and failed regulatory goal attainment motivates unethical behavior
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: On the basis of regulatory fit theory we argue and show that a regulatory fit induced through successful or failed attainment of goals that specify gains vs. losses (Study 1) or nurturance vs. security (Study 2), will lead individuals to engage in unethical behavior in a subsequent task.
Index Keywords: Goal attainment

Title: Evaluating negative evaluation: An experimental investigation of category spanning
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Integrating moderation and mediation: A structural equation modeling approach
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: While moderation and mediation are commonly used techniques to understand complex organizational phenomena, the statistical techniques have advanced since the Baron and Kenny (1986) article. The important advantage SEM over regression is because SEM allows the researchers to incorporate measurement error. Such advantages of SEM are even more important for interaction terms. SEM offers also confirmatory factor analysis capabilities which can improve our models and understanding (Lebreton et al., 2009). Further it is also a recommended technique in for testing fit of causal models to the data (James et al., 2006). While researchers have acknowledged the advantages of SEM over regression, SEM procedures for interaction effects had been rather complex and inaccessible to most researchers. The goal of the current manuscript is to provide a single one step approach to combine moderation and mediation analysis and extend it into a SEM framework. We do so using the simple and accessible syntax using the Mplus software package (Muthén &Muthén, 1998-2010).
Index Keywords: Factor analysis; Causal model; Confirmatory factor analysis; Interaction effect; Interaction term; Mediation analysis; Statistical techniques; Structural equation modeling; Aluminum alloys

Title: Delicate diplomacy: Insights from Libya for mnes about balancing political and social relations within host countries
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The impact of product market competition on corporate social responsibility
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study examines whether product market competition affects corporate social responsibility (CSR). Using a difference-in-differences methodology around the implementation of large import tariff reductions in the U.S. manufacturing sector, I find that companies react to fiercer competition by increasing their CSR. This suggests that companies use CSR as competitive strategy.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Competitive strategy; Corporate social responsibilities (CSR); Difference-in-differences; Import tariff; Manufacturing sector; Product market competitions; Competition

Title: Putting power into empowerment: Reconceptualizing the empowered state and the empowerment process
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Despite its consistent application by management scientists and practitioners, an in-depth review of empowerment literature concludes the construct lacks conceptual clarity. After a refined definition of the empowered state is presented, a model of the empowerment process is proposed.

Title: Free to quit: The effects of prior layoffs on voluntary turnover
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Utilizing a fixed effects specification of survival analysis, we find support for psychological contract based predictions of a positive but decreasing effect of prior layoffs on quit likelihood. Mediation analysis indicates that underemployment in the post-layoff job only partially mediates the layoff effect, providing additional support for psychological contract arguments.
Index Keywords: Decreasing effect; Fixed effects; Mediation analysis; Psychological contracts; Survival analysis

Title: Prioritizing the factors affecting the retailer's supply chain performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Crime and punishment: The reputational consequences of withdrawal from VC syndicates
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Managing boundaries in tripartite cross-sector partnerships
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The cross-cultural validation of the three-factor model of fit
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Markets as meta-interpretive systems
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Limited liability and moral hazard implications-an alternative reading of the financial crisis
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Family firm incumbent's attitude toward intra-family succession: Antecedents and effect on intention
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Intention for intra-family leadership succession (IFS) is an important determinant of family firm behavior. Based on the theory of planned behavior (TPB) we investigate antecedents of the incumbent leader's attitude toward IFS. Using a sample of 271 family firms in Italy, we identify different family-, firm-, and incumbent-related influencing factors.
Index Keywords: Family firms; Theory of Planned Behavior

Title: A bridge over troubled water? the push and pull of team conflict on between-team network ties
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The illusions of power
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper explains why poor performance undermines the power of the organization's leaders, but superior performance has a surprisingly weak impact on reinforcing that power. Integrating the research on performance feedback and organizational power, I show that dominant coalition's influence is limited both by anticipation as well as by satiation.
Index Keywords: Performance feedback; Poor performance

Title: Influencing upward: Subordinates' responses to leaders' awareness of their empowerment expectations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Using abstract language signals power
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Behavioral and institutional influences on energy saving initiatives
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Business forums pave the way to ethical decision-making: The mediating role of moral courage and religious mission
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Five years of survey data collected at business forum events suggests that the interaction between students and business advisory members or alumni is making a difference in students' self-assessed ability to show greater moral courage and an increased awareness of the religious mission of their institution.
Index Keywords: Ethical decision making; Mediating roles; Moral courage; Survey data

Title: Follow the follower? performance consequences of leaderfollower imitation under uncertainty
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Applicant attitudes across the recruitment process: Time is of the essence
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study applies decision-making theory on predecision attitude development to explain how three applicant attitudes about possible employers are built during recruitment. Findings indicate that applicants initially developed significantly more positive attitudes about a dominant alternative compared to other alternatives and these attitudes are reinforced over the recruitment process.
Index Keywords: Decision-making theories; Positive attitude; Recruitment process; Decision theory

Title: Be fair or care? fairtrade and the standardization of ethical practices
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Toward an alternative form of play in organizations: A practice-based perspective on SLAs
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We develop the notion of social ludic activities (SLAs) as an alternative form of playful practice which espouses an employee perspective. We advance a framework that accounts for the dialectical relationships between the micro and macro levels and incorporates the practice, practitioner and praxis elements into the analysis of SLAs.
Index Keywords: Micro and macro levels

Title: The effects and multilayeredness of inter-organizational and institutional trust in key partnerships1
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Employee work-to-family conflict and career outcomes: Differential effects of manager supportive behaviors
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Integrating conservation of resources and job demands-resources theories, we hypothesized that work-family conflict (WFC) negatively relates to career outcomes through manager assessments of employee job engagement. Results indicated support for our model. Further, the negative relation between WFC and job engagement was attenuated based on manager work supportive behaviors.
Index Keywords: Conservation; Managers; Conservation of resources; Differential effect; Job demands; Work-family conflict; Professional aspects

Title: Minority rules: Credible state ownership and investment risk around the world
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Power and effect size in supply chain research
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Emotional sensegiving
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Based on an analysis of video data, we identify a form of influence that we call 'emotional sensegiving.' Making sensereceivers experience emotional arousal increases the effectiveness of sensegiving. Identity threats can be used to generate emotional arousal but with a high risk of causing painful emotions that make sensegiving fail.
Index Keywords: Video data

Title: Leaving a legacy of transgenerational success: The effect of socioemotional wealth on ceo career horizons in family firms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A study of developing emotional, social, and cogntive competencies in 16 cohorts of an MBA program
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Why offering participative opportunities does not necessariely facilitate speaking up
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: In this study, we first developed a valid measure for a construct called harmony-oriented implicit voice belief. Using a two-wave data collected from a sample of Chinese 173 employees, our results showed a three-way interaction among harmony-oriented implicit voice beliefs, participative opportunity and group cooperative goal on employee voice.
Index Keywords: Employee voices; Three-way interactions; Two waves

Title: Exploring the strategic adoption of environmental certified management standards by small firms in the Oregon wine industry
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Through an exploratory study in the wine industry, this study finds that small companies invest in environmental certified management standards (CMS) as tools to signal legitimacy and compliance to stakeholders, as well as a means to develop and enhance capabilities in sustainable operations.
Index Keywords: Regulatory compliance; Exploratory studies; Management standards; Small companies; Small firm; Sustainable operations; Wine industry; Environmental management

Title: Imposing cooperation: The impact of institutions on the efficiency of cooperatives in an emerging market
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: In emerging markets, cooperatives may suffer from negative spillovers from the sociopolitical dysfunctions of their surrounding environment. Through an analysis of electric cooperatives in the Philippines, we find that cooperatives are less efficient than their investorowned counterparts and their performance is more sensitive to the quality of government.
Index Keywords: Electric cooperatives; Emerging markets; Philippines; Surrounding environment; Commerce

Title: Female entrepreneurship and alternative opportunities inside an established firm
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The dual effects of star scientist turnover on exploitation and exploration
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Who will fit in? the impacts of outside ceo successors' prior experience with board diversity
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The chosen ones the selection of capabilities in professional service firms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: The proceedings contain 246 papers. The topics discussed include: exploring the strategic adoption of environmental certified management standards by small firms in the Oregon wine industry; the effects of socialized charismatic leadership on climate of respect, mistreatment, and work attitudes; harmony: a Chinese construct for extending the social exchange framework; anchoring relationships at work: mentors as buffers to ambient racial discrimination; entry modes at the base of the economic pyramid: the emergence of hybrid organizational forms; and CSR and HRM: a review and conceptual analysis.

Title: Resource similarity versus complementarity: Governance determinants for asymmetric alliances
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Cross-border mergers and acquisitions and the mediating role of socio-cultural integration processes
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Unpacking dynamic capability deployment: A longitudinal case study of 5 US defense firms facing 9/11
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Knowledge sharing in a health and human services network
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We posit that strong ties between service providers and their co-clique relationships with third party actors (general contractor vs. service providers) affect knowledge sharing. Network analysis of data from a mental health network confirms our hypotheses. We found a weakened effect when strong ties are in co-clique relationships with the general contractor.
Index Keywords: Contractors; Information management; Knowledge management; General contractors; Health and human services; Knowledge-sharing; Mental health; Service provider; Third parties; Internet service providers

Title: Negotiating environmental responsibility in the supply chain
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: I feel close to you, dońt you?-antecedents of psychic distance asymmetry
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Common language differences in global virtual teams: The role of media and social categorization
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Values and belif structure of od practitioners in the GCC region
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper is intended to define OD practitioner's values and beliefs structure in the Gulf Cooperation Council (GCC) region including attitudes, motivators, and rewards. A comparison is made across Organization Development (OD) practitioners set of beliefs in the GCC region versus United States (US) and global OD practitioners.
Index Keywords: Gulf Cooperation Council; Organization development; Values and beliefs

Title: From values to value: Sustainability reporting and the dynamics of commensuration
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Spinoffs in different contexts: Theory and empirical evidence
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Leading across language barriers: Strategies to mitigate negative language-induced emotions in multinational corporations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A multilevel construct validation of safety climate
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: The purpose of this study was to conduct a multilevel construct validation of safety climate. Results from two samples revealed that safety climate was represented well across levels by a single factor. In addition, results revealed that safety climate's associations with safety incidents were proportionately stronger at the workgroup level.
Index Keywords: Safety climate; Safety incidents; Workgroups; Safety factor

Title: Leader's core self-evaluation, ethical leadership, and employee's job performance: The moderating role of employee's exchange ideology
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Examining the role of observer personality on the predictive validity of personality ratings
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Drawing on Hogan's Socioanalytic Theory and Funder's Realistic Accuracy Model, I investigate sources of variance in the predictive validity of reputational personality ratings. Results indicate that in terms of predicting job performance, observer characteristics (openness and conscientiousness) moderate the extent to which reputational personality ratings outperform identity ratings.
Index Keywords: Accuracy model; Job performance

Title: Framing, resonance, and micro-mobilization: Shall we say what we are for, or what we are against?
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Social movement frames can stress the positive attributions of movement supporters (protagonistic frames) or the negative attributions of movement opponents (antagonistic frames). Our interviews and experiments show that antagonistic frames engaged extreme supporters more than moderate supporters, and that the interaction of antagonism and extreme ideology provoked radical tactics.
Index Keywords: Social movements

Title: Understanding the differences among academic disciplines
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The joint effects of issue importance, managerial openness, and positive mood on voice and tactics
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Managing expectations to create high performance government
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Knowledge transfer and social networks in health care
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: How do professionals share knowledge in health care settings? Collecting social network data in a hospital department in Italy, we found that occupational boundaries inhibit the flow of professional knowledge. Occupational boundaries, however, do not tell the whole story: the structure of informal interactions helps explain patterns of knowledge exchange.
Index Keywords: Health care; Informal interactions; Knowledge exchange; Knowledge transfer; Professional knowledge; Share knowledge; Knowledge management

Title: Intrapersonal functional diversity and multiteam system performance: A moderated dual-pathway model
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The paradox of collaboration in inventive activities
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Leadership and individual innovation: A cross-cultural study of mediating psychological processes
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This cross-cultural study models the psychological processes by which leadership relates to individual innovation. R&D leaders and team members in an automotive company answered surveys in four countries. Leadership (conceptualized by LMX theory) was positively associated with individual innovation. Creative self-efficacy and personal initiative mediated this relationship with innovative outcomes.
Index Keywords: Automotive companies; Creative self-efficacy; Cross-cultural study; Psychological process; Team members; Social sciences

Title: Shadow of the past in the contract-trust interplay: A meta-analysis and a field study
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Star performers in twenty-first-century organizations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We offer nine propositions to guide future empirical research on stars performers and an underlying power law distribution of individual performance. We describe how stars affect all management theories addressing individual performance and offer specific implications for human capital, turnover, compensation, downsizing, leadership, teamwork, corporate entrepreneurship, and microfoundations of strategy.
Index Keywords: Human resource management; Corporate entrepreneurship; Empirical research; Human capitals; Individual performance; Management theory; Micro-foundations; Power law distribution; Stars

Title: The joint impact of job complexity, autonomy, and personality differences on employee job stress
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examine the relationship between job complexity and job stress with two sets of longitudinal data. Based on job-demand-control theory and person-situation interaction, we propose that job autonomy and employees' personality (openness to experience and emotional stability) jointly moderate the relationship between job complexity and employees job stress.
Index Keywords: Employment; Emotional stabilities; Job demands; Job stress; Longitudinal data; Control theory

Title: Matching technology strategy with knowledge structure: Implications for firm performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A field experiment examining the relationship between generativity and appreciative inquiry
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Performance, capabilities and strategic actions: Competitive dynamics in an emerging economy
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A process model of strategic network member acquisition and retention
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examine a strategic network's' internal processes in retaining existing members, and in recruiting new ones. Three core processes (sensing, attracting, and securing) and the co-specialized activities of its two key actor groups were identified, and represent a first grounded model of member acquisition and retention processes in strategic networks.
Index Keywords: Key Actors; Process Modeling; Retention process

Title: Entrepreneurial responses to hostile environments
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Relational pluralism: Organizational foresight in practice
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examined how the organizing practices and social relationships of lower participants may influence strategic foresight. We then suggest relational incumbency as a transient conceptual framework to specify how the organizing social relationships and interactions of lower level employees, may encourage the enactment of intelligent 'foresightful' actions.
Index Keywords: Conceptual frameworks; Social relationships; Strategic foresight; Social aspects

Title: The multiple temporalities of changeful organizational practice
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: New venture survival: External shocks, exploration and exploitation alliances
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Strategic investments under earnings pressure: The role of performance feedback
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The impact of task-, social-, and environmental context characteristics on firm proactiveness
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Collaborating or selling patients? a conceptual framework of between-unit handoff negotiations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Hunger, hegemony, and social inequality: Organizations and the discourse of food in the US
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper draws on Gramsci's framework of hegemony to consider the relationship between rising income inequality and poverty in the US and growing levels of hunger. It uses a hegemonic framework to consider how food is produced and distributed, the causes of hunger and obesity, and counter hegemonic movements.
Index Keywords: Income inequality; Social inequalities

Title: That should be me: How status in the corporate elite affects the propensity for demographic minority ceos to get blamed for low firm performance by other ceos and journalists
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We explore the potential for social discrimination in the corporate elite. Drawing from the intergroup relations and status competition literatures, we suggest how out-group biases and envy toward higher-status minority CEOs may prompt white male CEOs to make negative performance attributions for the minority CEOs in their communications with journalists.
Index Keywords: Firm Performance

Title: Who serves the self from the seat of power? predicting self-interested leader behavior
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Here, I argue that because power increases goal orientation, leaders with self-focused goals (arising from, for instance, narcissism or individualism) or whose power is threatened (e.g., from self-doubt) will be especially likely to use their position for self-benefit, to the neglect of group and organizational needs. Supporting evidence is reviewed.
Index Keywords: Goal orientations; Power increase

Title: Local elites versus dominant shareholders: Dividend smoothing at the Dutch east India company
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper analyses the Dutch East India Company's (VOC) dividend policy and finds that when investors from Amsterdam, especially the Sephardic Jews, took control over the Company's Zeeland chamber, dividends smoothed and started signaling stability. This suggests that the concentration of corporate ownership can foster continuity instead of market perversion.
Index Keywords: Amsterdam; Dividend smoothing; East india companies; Paper analysis; Investments

Title: Surviving organizational death how members draw upon and reconstruct organizational identity in times of organizational death
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Ironic effects of flexible work practices on parents' career success
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Playing the game and trying not to lose myself: On the institutional pressures for research output
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Working from a doctoral student's perspective, I integrate anecdotal evidence with Foucault's idea of the panopticon to illuminate how institutional pressures for research output become codified. I consider how we can more fruitfully serve doctoral students by embracing the concept of 'ontological empathy' and by redefining the meaning of 'success'.
Index Keywords: Anecdotal evidences; Institutional pressures; Panopticon; Research outputs

Title: Managing expatriate evacuations in times of crisis: A crossindustry comparison
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Expertise recognition in interdisciplinary care teams and its effect on team performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Opening up but staying local: Insights from partnership formations between established and startup firms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examine when established firms go beyond local search and pursue partnering opportunities with novel elements of knowledge. The study provides insights into how established firms respond to emerging partnering opportunities from startup firms and illustrates the role of internal failure and experimentation in R&D to attenuate local search tendencies.
Index Keywords: Established firms; Internal failure; Local search; Local search (optimization)

Title: Promoting ethical consumption or protecting local elites? tensions in the us 'buy local' movement
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Buy local' campaigns argue that local firms produce economic, social, and environmental community benefits, but critics charge that localism merely protects privileged local stakeholders' interests. We find that US 'buy local' organizations focused on marketing and failed to police members' socially responsible actions, but promoted community cohesion and disseminated sustainability information.
Index Keywords: Community cohesions; Sustainability informations; Sustainable development

Title: Board age and gender diversity: A test of competing linear and curvilinear predictions
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We test competing linear and curvilinear predictions between board diversity and performance. The predictions were tested using archival data on 288 organizations listed on the Australian Securities Exchange. The findings provide additional evidence on the business case for board gender diversity and refine the business case for board age diversity.
Index Keywords: Archival data; Business case; Gender diversity; Forecasting

Title: The combined roles of mastery and performance climates in implementing creative ideas
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Not all creative ideas get implemented. Two field studies, in China (117 employees nested within 21 groups) and Slovenia (240 employees nested into 34 groups), revealed a threeway interaction of idea generation × performance climate × mastery climate in predicting idea implementation.
Index Keywords: Creative ideas; Field studies; Idea generation; Slovenia; Three-way interactions

Title: Microfinance and innovation ecosystem: Evidence from Brazil and insights for social entrepreneurship
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Researchers in the fields of entrepreneurship and strategy have dedicated increasing attention to the perspective of innovation ecosystems. By revealing conditions under which microfinance practices influence innovation ecosystems but have different implications for entrepreneurship, we extend the literature on microfinance, innovation ecosystems, and social entrepreneurship.
Index Keywords: Ecology; Finance; Microfinance; Social entrepreneurship; Ecosystems

Title: The influence of state ownership on innovation in market competition
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Was my social identity just threatened? making meaning of gendered cues in stem academe
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The pursuit of positive affect in task advice networks: Effects on individual performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Conservation of responsibility & context manipulation in high context communication cultures
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Focusing on five incidents of norm violations occurring within a traditional Japanese organization-a martial arts dojo-during a five-year participant observation ethnography, I provide a thick description of high context communication, wherein what is not said is often considered more important than what is said, demonstrating communication subtleties.
Index Keywords: High contexts; Martial art; Norm violation; Participant observations

Title: Leaders' management of creative ideas: The joint impact of achievement goals and position power
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Opening innovation in regulation inside government: The contribution of innovative users
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Knoweldge transfer across hierarchical lines: The importance of organizational structure and type of knowledge
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper uses football and ice hockey as archetypal contexts to explore managerial knowledge transfer to subordinates in tall and flat organizational structures. Interviews with players and coaches, and observations of team meetings, practices, and games, revealed different mechanisms for transferring declarative knowledge (tall context) and procedural knowledge (flat context).
Index Keywords: Sports; Declarative knowledge; Different mechanisms; Ice hockey; Knowledge transfer; Organizational structures; Procedural knowledge; Team meetings; Knowledge management

Title: Strategic linkages between the information technology governance and the propensity to innovation in research & development industries: An empirical study on corporate practices
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Tell me who you want me to be: The role of collective endorsements in leader identity development
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Big fish in little ponds: A multilevel approach to reputation in organizations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Consensus and conflict: Exploring moderating effects of knowledge workers on industry environment and entrepreneurial entry
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We examine how the knowledge workers in the labor force moderate the relationship between industry environmental conditions and entrepreneurial entry using two competing theoretical frameworks: the consensus theory and the conflict theory of employment. Results indicate that the two frameworks can be integrated to explain entrepreneurial entry in knowledge-based economy.
Index Keywords: Knowledge based systems; Knowledge management; Conflict theory; Consensus theory; Environmental conditions; Industry environment; Knowledge based economy; Knowledge workers; Moderating effect; Theoretical framework; Information management

Title: The role of ethical reputation in the evaluation of VC investors: The entrepreneurs' view
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: The intersection of ethics and venture capital has received limited research attention. Addressing this gap, our findings reveal that an investor's ethical reputation directly impacts the entrepreneurs' willingness to partner. Such reputations also play a key interaction role when considered alongside the venture capitalists' value-adding capabilities and investment track record.
Index Keywords: Investments; Track record; Venture Capital; Venture capitalists; Philosophical aspects

Title: The ford foundation's "mess" in management education in Brazil
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper is an empirical account of the founding relationship between the US Ford Foundation (FF), and the Sao Paulo Business School. Our finding is that it is wrong to perceive the processes and outcomes of FF interventions in management education as following a wholly US-impositionalist agenda.
Index Keywords: Business schools; Management education; Sao Paulo

Title: Innovation and external risk assessments
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Prior research has emphasized the returns of innovation without fully considering the corresponding risks. This current study proposes that exploration increases risk assessments because of the difficulties evaluators have understanding how firms create and capture value from innovation. These ideas are supported based on an analysis of rating agency evaluations.
Index Keywords: Rating agencies; Risk assessment

Title: CSR and HRM: A review and conceptual analysis
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The evolution of innovation: Crowdsourcing as a heterogeneous organizational practice
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Governance trade-offs: Do boards use severance contracts to insure new ceos against intense monitoring?
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Being held back by the old: Incumbent inertia and renewable energy technologies
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Persistence of existing resource stocks can hold a firm back in the old, while environmental shifts push firms toward resource renewal. We study the interplay between regulatory policy and competition on a focal firm's new technology investments in the context of the U.S. utilities industry between 1999 and 2010.
Index Keywords: Competition; Investments; Environmental shifts; Regulatory policies; Renewable energy technologies; Technology investments; Renewable energy resources

Title: Short-term and long-term stability in electronic communication networks
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Network researchers typically focus on patterns of stable relationships, where stability represents the unfolding of social processes over long time frames. By contrast, we argue and empirically demonstrate that social interactions exhibit regularities across different time frames (short and long-term), reflecting distinct social processes.
Index Keywords: Electronic communications; Long term stability; Short term; Social interactions; Social process; Time frame

Title: Balancing exploration and exploitation: Simultaneous versus sequential approaches
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Despite the widespread consensus that the balance between exploration and exploitation is crucial for long-term performance and survival, few studies have examined the mode through which this balance is achieved. Drawing on 1981-2011 data from the Korean IT industry, this study investigates the effects of this mode on organizational longevity.
Index Keywords: Balancing exploration and exploitations; Exploration and exploitation; IT industry; Long term performance; Sequential approach

Title: Avoiding capability traps through contingent contracts: Cash and knowhow in startups
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: How do boards engage in product innovation? a hybrid multi-channel governance framework
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The signaling role of bit stringency for facilitating fdi
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: A signaling theory of strategic interaction between a foreign investor and a state hosting foreign direct investment (FDI) identifies the conditions under which the designs of bilateral investment treaties (BITs) facilitate FDI. The paper offers a new theory, new quantitative measure, BIT stringency, and the empirical analysis for 1984-2007.
Index Keywords: Empirical analysis; Foreign direct investments; Foreign investors; New theory; Quantitative measures; Signaling theory; Strategic interactions

Title: The engagement gap. exploring and mitigating gender differences in university-industry collaborative activities
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Recently, debate on women in academic science has been extended to academics' engagement with industry. We suggest that women tend to engage less in industry collaboration than their male colleagues of similar status. We argue that differences are mitigated by the presence of other women and by social support mechanisms.
Index Keywords: Academic science; Collaborative activities; Gender differences; Industry collaboration; Social support; University industries

Title: Self-regulated cognition, interpersonal influence, and recommendations for board appointments in the corporate elite
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study contributes to the literatures on corporate governance and leadership by enhancing our understanding of the psychological mechanisms by which corporate leaders gain interpersonal influence with their colleagues. We suggest that in anticipation of social interaction with a high-status demographically dissimilar colleague, individuals tend to reflect on characteristics shared with that colleague, while avoiding thoughts about characteristics not shared. We further suggest why this pattern of cognition increases the credibility of flattery and opinion conformity, ultimately facilitating efforts by corporate leaders to advance to relatively central positions in the corporate elite through the acquisition of multiple board appointments.
Index Keywords: Corporate governance; Corporate leaders; Interpersonal influences; Social interactions; Mergers and acquisitions

Title: Firm performance in dymanic environments: The role of operational slack and operational flexibility
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Structure-agency: Disentangling the selection and influence mechanisms in the carbon market
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Legitimation work within a cross-sector social partnership
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study illuminates how a cross-sector social partnership legitimizes itself towards multiple internal and external stakeholders. My analysis shows that the main objects that needed legitimacy as well as the audiences from which legitimacy was mainly sought changed over time and that legitimation work occured across objects, audiences and time.
Index Keywords: Cross sectors; External stakeholders; Main objects; Social partnership

Title: Rubik's dilemma: Partial knowledge and the efficacy of learning
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Is there a singular driver of entrepreneurship? power-law dynamics of organizational emergence and growth
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Empirical findings show that power-law distributions most accurately characterize all revenue-and employee-based outcomes in entrepreneurship. We hypothesize that "opportunity tension" is the mechanism that initiates and perpetuates these distributions. Non-linear tests indicate significant support for our hypothesis, providing a solid foundation for a scale-free theory of new venture performance.
Index Keywords: Empirical findings; New venture performance; Non linear; Power law distribution; Power-law; Scale-free

Title: The good, the bad, and the fuzzy: A configurational approach to acquisitions
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Do professional service organizations financially benefit from conformance and experiential quality? an econometric analysis of U.S. Acute care hospitals
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Complexity mechanisms in human interaction dynamics: The organizing functions of leadership
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Should small firms launch new products during high or low seasons?
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The emergence of collective corporate entrepreneurial identity
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Spawned with a rusty spoon: How and when can spin-outs cope with parent hostility?
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: How much to integrate? firms' R and D allocations in emerging standard settings
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The motive expression-attribution model of pro-customer rule breaking
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Employees sometimes break rules to enhance customer service. We introduce the Expression-Attribution model of pro-customer rule breaking (PCRB) to explain how PCRB is experienced by the employee/customer dyad. Employees use PCRB to express motivational orientations toward the organization and the customer, while customers form impression-based attributions about these motivational orientations.
Index Keywords: Customer services; Form impressions; Motivational orientation; Sales

Title: Unethical customers and employee burnout: The role of ethical leadership
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We argue that organizations can more effectively manage employees' reactions to customer unethical behavior by hiring and/or training ethical leaders. We find support for a moderated-mediation model whereby ethical leadership mitigates the indirect relationship between customer unethical behavior and employee outcomes, as mediated by employee emotional exhaustion.
Index Keywords: Personnel training; Philosophical aspects; Sales; Ethical leadership; Job satisfaction

Title: Personality, intelligence, and negotiation outcomes: A meta-analysis of the evidence
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The role of narcissism and should counterfactual thinking in the hindsight bias
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: The current study examined the effects of narcissism and should counterfactual thinking on the hindsight bias, and the moderating role of outcome favorability. Experimental data from 169 participants revealed that narcissism and outcome favorability interactively influenced should counterfactual thinking, which in turn influenced the hindsight bias.

Title: Stable versus shifting ethical leadership: The impact on team positivity and performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The paradox of fit: How perceptions of fit impede organizational change
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Drawing on a three-year study of a firm's implementation of a new practice we unravel an apparent paradox: a change that lacked fit with established organizational values was effectively implemented, while one that was perceived to fit was not. Our subsequent theorizing contributes to our understanding of organizational change.
Index Keywords: Organizational change

Title: Optimal ownership division in venture capital investment
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Team emotion suppression climate: Conceptualization and a preliminary multilevel investigation
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Explaining mechanisms of social entrepreneurs internationalization: Concept of social cosmopreneur
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Inconsistency in performance feedback and R and D investment
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Prospection: Review and reflections on forward-looking behavior of firms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: With the agenda of stimulating and shaping discourse around "forward-looking" behavior in strategy literature, I review over five decades of macro research-spanning strategic management and organization theories-that evoke, advocate and engage with forward-looking behavior of firms. I also propose future directions for research in this area.
Index Keywords: Forward looking; Organization theory; Strategic management

Title: Career as antecedent of entrepreneurial decision-making: Uncovering the role of prediction and control
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study explores how career experiences shape entrepreneurs' preferences for causal and effectual decision logics. Through a grounded theory approach, based on verbal protocols and interviews, we distinguish four career profiles. Each profile represents different emphases on control and prediction and varying degrees to which entrepreneurs prefer effectuation and causation.
Index Keywords: Decision logic; Grounded theory approach; Prediction and control; Verbal protocols

Title: A meta-analytic path analysis of leadership, organizational culture, and unit performance
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We conduct a meta-analytic path analysis to investigate organizational culture as an intervening mechanism between leadership and unit performance. Results show that clan and market cultures partially mediate the relationship between relational and task leadership and unit performance. In addition, market culture mediates relationship between clan culture and unit performance.
Index Keywords: Commerce; Organizational cultures; Path analysis; Regression analysis

Title: Social movements and corporate political activity: An examination of corporate and regulatory responses to socially-oriented investor activism
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Do global 'best practices' in performance management meet employees' preferences? empirical evidence from China, Germany, South Africa, and the USA
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The historical roots of firm access to finance (abridged version)
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Emotional appeal in recruiting advertisement and applicant attraction: Unpacking national cultural differences
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Through two studies across three countries (China, US, and Singapore), we found cultural orientation moderated the relationship between type of emotional appeal used in recruiting advertisements and applicant attraction to firms. Moreover, a job applicant's regulatory focus mediated the moderating influence of cultural orientation. Discussions ensue for theory and practice.
Index Keywords: Cultural difference; Cultural orientation; Job applicant; Regulatory focus; Singapore; Theory and practice

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Task complexity and value orientation: Exploring the moderators of a social dilemma in social networks
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We take a social dilemmas perspective to understand whether social actors' network strategies can be at odds with the interests of their collective entities. We focus on brokerage and closure. We analyze two moderators: the task complexity at play in the collective, and its individualist versus collectivist value orientation.
Index Keywords: Moderators; Network strategy; Social actors; Social dilemmas; Task complexity; Value orientation; Complex networks

Title: The second time farce: Business school ethicists and the emergence of bastard rawlsianism
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: While Rawls is widely cited by business ethicists, these same ethicists generally ignore the central focus of his work, the promotion of economic and political fairness, despite its obvious contemporary relevance. This bowdlerization of Rawls parallels the post-war practices of American "bastard" Keynesians, but without achieving the latter's real-world impact.
Index Keywords: Business schools; Real-world

Title: Reunited: Exploring the performance effects of newcomers' tie reactivation in interdependent organizations
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Effect of hospital referral networks on appropriateness of hospitalization decisions: An HLM analysis
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: From goldilocks to gump: A research agenda for entrepreneurial mechanisms design
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The gang of four: Acquaintances, friends or foes? towards an integrated perspective on platform competition
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Technological platform competition unfolds beyond the boundaries of a single market. Firstly, platforms make business model choices about the core functionality with the main goal of stimulating reinforcing network effects between user groups; secondly, they expand into neighboring markets in search of cross-platform complementarities. This expansion blurs market boundaries and creates a 'supra-platform market'.
Index Keywords: Business modeling; Core functionality; Cross-platform; Network effects; Technological platform; User groups; Commerce

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: A temporal approach to successful turnaround in declining firms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This paper posits that the turnaround effects of retrenchment are time-contingent and action-specific. Data from 96 matched-pair firms supported our thesis, indicating that early divestments and early geographic market exits, but not early layoffs, were positively related to turnaround success whereas the late retrenchment actions had the opposite effects.
Index Keywords: Geographic market; Temporal approach

Title: Perceivers' implicit theories, violation type, and moral awareness
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Three studies provide consistent evidence that abilities to recognize moral content in situations (moral awareness) are interactively dependent upon observers' implicit theories (entity versus incremental) and whether the observed situation involves a duty versus a rights violation.

Title: Institutional embeddedness of ee firms in advanced economies: A longitudinal, multi-industry study
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Shareholder activism in Europe: Evidence from shareholder dissent in France, Germany, and the U.K.
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Grounded in an organizational approach to comparative corporate governance, we develop and test a theory on how cost/benefit considerations affect shareholders dissent (i.e., shareholder votes cast against management at shareholder meetings) in a large sample of shareholder and management proposals in France, Germany, and the United Kingdom.
Index Keywords: Corporate governance; Cost/benefit; Shareholder activisms; United kingdom; Shareholders

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The phenomenology of failed humor: Preliminary implications for interpersonal affect regulation
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: Inadequate attention has been paid to failed interpersonal affect regulation. We examine failed interpersonal affect regulation through the lens of humor. Individual differences including gender and positive affectivity influenced reactions to failed humor. Four individual differences were related to people's self-reported motivation to persist in the regulation of others' emotions.
Index Keywords: Individual Differences; Through the lens

Title: Do gurus breed gurus? an analysis of collaboration in design
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Seeing past the orange: An inductive investigation of organizational respect in a prison context
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This project develops grounded theory on how respect is received and internalized in organizations, and the personal and work-related outcomes of receiving respect. A company that employs prison inmates provided a unique context for data collection, as respect is typically problematic in prison but was deliberately instilled by this company.
Index Keywords: Data collection; Grounded theory; Prison inmates; Work-related; Prisons

Title: Proactive behaviors and employability among temporary workers
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: This study tests the mediating effect of leader-member exchange in the relationship between temporary agency workers' proactive socialization behaviors and employability-related outcomes, namely, supervisory performance evaluation and supervisor's willingness to rehire. Results show that LMX mediates the relationship between feedback seeking, boss-relationship building, and positive framing and employability outcomes.
Index Keywords: Feedback seeking; Leader-member exchanges; Mediating effect; Proactive behavior; Relationship building; Workers'

Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: Drugs, sweat, and gears: An organizational analysis of performance enhancing drug use in the 2010 tour de France
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We argue that an actor's role in organizational strategy and ties to known deviants will increase the likelihood of wrongdoing. Empirical analysis of performance enhancing drug use among professional cyclists supports these arguments. Specifically, ties to unpunished offenders increase later drug use while ties to heavily punished offenders reduces wrongdoing.
Index Keywords: Empirical analysis; Organizational analysis; Organizational strategy; Performance enhancing; Professional cyclists

Title: Board social capital and excess CEO compensation
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We suggest that the board's external and internal social capital are important concepts that may affect the board's ability to keep excess CEO pay under control. Further, we bridge the board social capital research with sociopolitical factors in order to provide a more holistic theoretical rationale for excess CEO compensation.
Index Keywords: CEO compensations; Social capitals

Title: High-status but low-performing: Effects of group status on information exchange and group outcome
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: We explored how group status influences group processes and outcomes, focusing on information exchange. We found that high-status groups exchanged information less, thereby reaching less desirable outcomes relative to low-status groups. Moderator analysis suggested that the effect was driven by the competitive orientation generated in high-status groups.
Index Keywords: Group process; Information exchanges; Moderator analysis; Information dissemination

Title: Entry modes at the base of the economic pyramid: The emergence of hybrid organizational forms
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013

Title: The primal mark: How the beginning shapes the end in the development of creative ideas
Source title: Academy of Management 2013 Annual Meeting, AOM 2013
Abstract: The concept of the "primal mark" is introduced-i.e., the first bit of content employees start with as they try to generate creative ideas. Results from two experiments on primal marks explain why and when the novelty and usefulness of ideas diverge and converge in the creative process.
Index Keywords: Creative ideas; Creative process
